snippet: This weekend, Mercy Independence Hospital in Kansas will join dozens of rural hospitals that have closed in the last five years, because of declining reimbursements, regulatory burdens and shrinking populations.
abstract: Residents of Independence, Kan, worry about implications of closing of Mercy Hospital for both their personal health and future of community; hospital will become 58th rural hospital to close in United States since 2010; rural hospital closures have increased in past several years due to number of factors, including decline in Medicare reimbursements.

byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and ABBY GOODNOUGH
byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Independence, and Abby Goodnough from Washington.

lead_paragraph: This weekend, Mercy Independence Hospital in Kansas will join dozens of rural hospitals that have closed in the last five years, because of declining reimbursements, regulatory burdens and shrinking populations.

headline.main: Closing a Hospital, and Fearing for the Future
